title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) 

Regulations 2022.

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations “Quota Regulation” means Council Regulation
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations “Quota Regulation” means Council Regulation 
(EU) 2022/109 of 27 January 2022 as amended by Council Regulation (EU) 
2022/515 of 31 March 2022. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in the Quota Regulation and is also 
used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same 
meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Quota Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation quota regulation mean council regulation (eu) 2022 109 27 january 2022 amended council regulation (eu) 2022 515 31 march 2022 (2) word expression used quota regulation also used regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation quota regulation

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 3. The master of -
text_raw:
3. The master of - 

(a) 

(b) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishery limits of the State 

shall comply with Articles 8, 13, 15, 16, 17, 18, 22, 25, 26, 28, 31, 32, 33, 35, 
36, 38, 39, 40, 41(2), 42, 43, 46, 47, 48 and 56 of the Quota Regulation.
text_norm: 3 master - (a) (b) irish sea-fishing boat wherever may sea-fishing boat exclusive fishery limit state shall comply article 8 13 15 16 17 18 22 25 26 28 31 32 33 35 36 38 39 40 41(2) 42 43 46 47 48 56 quota regulation

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of -
text_raw:
4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of - 

(a) 

(b) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishery limits of the State 

shall comply with Article 11(1), (2), (3) and (4) of the Quota Regulation in 
relation to sea bass. 

(2) The master of an Irish sea-fishing boat operating in ICES Sub-area 6 or 
ICES Sub-area 7 is subject to the Bass (Conservation of Stocks) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 230 of 2006) in relation to sea bass. 

1 OJ L 21, 31.1.2022, p.1 
2 OJ L 104 1.4.2022, p.1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 17th June, 2022 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [290] 3 

(3) A person engaged in recreational fisheries that is fishing for sea bass 

shall comply with Articles 11(5), and 12(2) of the Quota Regulation.
text_norm: 4 (1) subject paragraph (2) master - (a) (b) irish sea-fishing boat wherever may sea-fishing boat exclusive fishery limit state shall comply article 11(1) (2) (3) (4) quota regulation relation sea bass (2) master irish sea-fishing boat operating ice sub-area 6 ice sub-area 7 subject bass (conservation stocks) regulation 2006 (s.i no 230 2006) relation sea bass 1 oj l 21 31.1.2022 p.1 2 oj l 104 1.4.2022 p.1 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 17th june 2022 290 3 (3) person engaged recreational fishery fishing sea bass shall comply article 11(5) 12(2) quota regulation

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 5. The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 69 of 2021) are
text_raw:
5. The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 69 of 2021) are 

revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

8 June, 2022. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [290]

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations have the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of 
(EU) 
Council Regulation 
2022/515 fixing for 2022 the fishing opportunities for certain fish stocks and 
groups of fish stocks, applicable in Union waters and, for Union fishing 
vessels, in certain non-Union waters. 

(EU) 2022/109 and Council Regulation 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [290] 5
